pages.text: Sinamacrops is a Anurognathid Pterosaur that lived in the Tiaojishan Formation of China during the Middle to Late Jurassic. It was discovered by Wei et al. in 2021. Sinamacrops is similar to many of the other Anurognathids that are known, however it has some distinguishing anotomaical features that make it unique to other pterosaurs. These are the spacing between their first three tooth sockets being close, and their tibiotarsus bone being twice as long as their femur. Sinamacrops is also the sister taxon to Batrachognathus, another genus of Anurognathid Pterosaur found in Kazakhstan.
